data.title: Classy Lattes in a beautiful mug
data.text: The best coffee in Redmond and the eastside, The lattes are served in a really nice white coffee mug. They also put a really neat design on the top. Cozy and cute and great food too

data.title: Original Redmond Coffee shop
data.text: Victors has been around forever and has that lived-in local coffee shop vibe.  Service is slow but generally friendly and the food I had, soup and sandwich,was good.

data.title: Morning coffee and pastries
data.text: Best coffee in town great breakfast sandwich and omelettes the croissants are delicious and are the pastries.

data.title: Great local coffehouse
data.text: This has been my favorite go to Coffee shop shop for years.  Pastries, sandwiches, drinks, coffee are all excellent and the rustic old school decor with local artists works just feels good... like its been here forever and won't fall victim to the pretentious shiny and new vibe all the new spots strive for.  That said, the one draw back is the owner can be a crotchety S.O.B. and I've  overheard him making less than flattering comments about his patrons which is just very odd...

data.title: Lovely
data.text: Great pastries, grreat coffee but the owner's curt, almost rude behaviour is very offputting. Listen, I don't mind waiting till you train your staff when I can have a warm friendly service at the end. Will be back but I let my husband handle you.

data.title: Great community gathering place - very good coffee
data.text: We've been going here for years, and they haven't changed much in that time - and that is a good thing. They serve very good coffee and baked goods, and egg dishes at breakfast and sandwiches at lunch. I've used Victor's to meet clients and colleagues and friends, and everyone likes it. Plenty of inside seating, lots of seats outside as well. Beware - there is no wifi and they are proud of it. Interact with others! Owner is a little crusty, but has been running a great operation.

data.title: Fun coffee joint with a gruff but fun owner
data.text: This coffee house has a nice rustic decor and is very popular with the locals.  The owner is gruff but fun and the coffee and pastries are good.  It's important to note that they only accept cash.

data.title: Warm and friendly coffee house
data.text:
Driven by many times (years, really) and never had the curiosity to try the place until a friend suggested.   Victor's is in an older strip mall in downtown Redmond and shares a parking lot.  No issues with parking but I can imagine on the weekends, it may be an issue.  I loved the warm and cozy feeling of the place and their selection of pastries and sandwiches/soups.   I ordered a cup of hot chocolate and oatmeal raisin cookie and loved it.  Hot chocolate warm and not overly sweet.  

If you're looking for wi-fi, this is not the place for you.  In fact, there's a sign that says,  "pretend its 1999 and talk to each other"  No wi-fi.      

This is now my go to place!

data.title: Always busy
data.text: Nice local coffee alternative from Starbucks.   It's always busy !!   They only accept cash.   They have a great chai but they were out the last time I was there.

data.title: Great coffee and fresh orange juice
data.text: I love this place, they always have Great coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice!! Nice servers and great atmosphere in Downtown Redmond.

data.title: Love their coffee!
data.text: in a starbucks world, Virctor's coffee takes the cake.. not bitter, nor over roasted.. the place is old time coffeeshop feel.

data.title: Owner is a grouch
data.text: This used to be our favorite place to meet family and friends for coffee.  Walter has made our  visits so unpleasant,  he told us we couldn't stay more than an hour,  that we needed to leave so he could make money,  he needed the parking lot open for more customers,  even though we all ordered food and drinks. He said he didn't care,  people will still keep coming back.  We are not coming back.  Also the bathroom is a mess and needs repairs.

data.title: The WORST service ever
data.text:
I would say do NOT visit this coffee shop.  The owner's rudeness is beyond a joke.  It's not cute.  It's not funny.  It's just bloody awful.
The coffee is ordinary, the pastries so-so.
Don't waste your money.
Don't put your hard earned cash into the pocket of this really ghastly man.
I have never in my life been treated with rudeness like I was at this coffee house.

data.title: Excellent Coffee
data.text: The coffee is the best, great atmosphere as well! My favorite specialty is the Irish Nudge with and without the homemade whipped cream.

data.title: Popular Spot Minus the Mermaid
data.text: First, I truly appreciate that this is not a chain featuring a mermaid.  Second, I love the funky seating vibe. Third, there is a great mix of people here: young and old, techy and traditional, hip and square...The coffee is fine, the food is fine (like the breakfast sandwiches), the parking is not so hot but downtown Redmond is really growing, so consider parking a few blocks away and walking in.  Indoor seating and outdoor seating.  Staff is perfectly fine.  You gotta know that they are CASH, no credit cards, so don't forget a tenner for a coffee or Italian soda and a baked good. This place does get very crowded, so consider coming after the morning rush if you don't want to be in line or smooshed!

data.title: A Hidden Gem in the Land of Coffee
data.text: In a town that is full of coffee, Victor's has some of the best around.  If you blink you might miss it, but I sure hope you don't!  The shop is great to sit down and enjoy your coffee.  Afterwards you can walk around and look at some of the shops in the area.  Don't miss this gem!

data.title: Nice local coffee
data.text:
By sure to bring in cash, these dudes are credit card snobs and will give you the looks for even asking.
Pastry and ok, but coffee is pretty good

data.title: Great coffee house
data.text: Pleasant staff. Quick service. Offers various pastries. Waffles on Saturday. Pumpkin cheese cake at Thanksgiving. Panini sandwiches for lunch. And a wonderful tomato soup. Parking sometimes can be a bit tricky. Wall art changes monthly.

data.title: The specialty coffees are a plenty
data.text: Had Cinnavon. So smooth and creamy! And I'm glad I had that because it comes with chocolate whip cream that is out of this world!

data.title: Good coffee, good place
data.text: OK, we heard that the owner is really crabby. But, in spite of that we still gave it a try. I drink only decaf and their decaf (already brewed, didn't have to wait like I do at the better known chain coffee shop) was very good, fully flavor! I will make Victor's a habit every time I am in Redmond!
